name: deliquescence

deliquescence noun [U]
(BECOMING LIQUID)
Add to word list
Add to word list
chemistry
  specialized the process of becoming liquid as a result of absorbing moisture from the air: Vitamin C supplements are prone to a process called deliquescence, in which humidity causes a water-soluble substance to dissolve.
the process of melting or turning into a liquid: There was talk about global warming and the deliquescence of the ice-caps.
More examplesFewer examplesDeliquescence of the mixed particle begins at a relative humidity which is lower than that required for any of the components.Salt deposits have the additional advantage of mineral deliquescence.Deliquescence is a classical phenomenon of physical chemistry.

deliquescence noun [U]
(DISAPPEARING)
formal the fact or process of gradually disappearing or being destroyed: Certain phases of Hayek's career are downplayed to the point of deliquescence in this book. Gorbachev noted the deliquescence of his country and his economy.
